004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.drive;
006
007import static java.util.Objects.requireNonNull;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tInstances;
010import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tResourceType;
011import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUtil;
013import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable;
014import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableBuilder;
015import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableRegistry;
016import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.motorcontrol.MotorController;
017
018/**
019 * A class for driving Killough drive platforms.
020 *
021 * <p>Killough drives are triangular with one omni wheel on each corner.
022 *
023 * <p>Drive base diagram:
024 *
025 * <pre>
026 *  /_____\
027 * / \   / \
028 *    \ /
029 *    ---
030 * </pre>
031 *
032 * <p>Each drive() function provides different inverse kinematic relations for a Killough drive. The
033 * default wheel vectors are parallel to their respective opposite sides, but can be overridden. See
034 * the constructor for more information.
035 *
036 * <p>This library uses the NED axes convention (North-East-Down as external reference in the world
037 * frame): http://www.nuclearprojects.com/ins/images/axis_big.png.
038 *
039 * <p>The positive X axis points ahead, the positive Y axis points right, and the positive Z axis
040 * points down. Rotations follow the right-hand rule, so clockwise rotation around the Z axis is
041 * positive.
042 *
043 * <p>{@link edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.MotorSafety} is enabled by default. The driveCartesian or
044 * drivePolar methods should be called periodically to avoid Motor Safety timeouts.
045 */
046public class KilloughDrive extends RobotDriveBase implements Sendable, AutoCloseable {
047  public static final double kDefaultLeftMotorAngle = 60.0;
048  public static final double kDefaultRightMotorAngle = 120.0;
049  public static final double kDefaultBackMotorAngle = 270.0;
050
051  private static int instances;
052
053  private MotorController m_leftMotor;
054  private MotorController m_rightMotor;
055  private MotorController m_backMotor;
056
057  private Vector2d m_leftVec;
058  private Vector2d m_rightVec;
059  private Vector2d m_backVec;
060
061  private boolean m_reported;
062
063  /**
064   * Wheel speeds for a Killough drive.
065   *
066   * <p>Uses normalized voltage [-1.0..1.0].
067   */
068  @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
069  public static class WheelSpeeds {
070    public double left;
071    public double right;
072    public double back;
073
074    /** Constructs a WheelSpeeds with zeroes for left, right, and back speeds. */
075    public WheelSpeeds() {}
076
077    /**
078     * Constructs a WheelSpeeds.
079     *
080     * @param left The left speed [-1.0..1.0].
081     * @param right The right speed [-1.0..1.0].
082     * @param back The back speed [-1.0..1.0].
083     */
084    public WheelSpeeds(double left, double right, double back) {
085      this.left = left;
086      this.right = right;
087      this.back = back;
088    }
089  }
090
091  /**
092   * Construct a Killough drive with the given motors and default motor angles.
093   *
094   * <p>The default motor angles make the wheels on each corner parallel to their respective
095   * opposite sides.
096   *
097   * <p>If a motor needs to be inverted, do so before passing it in.
098   *
099   * @param leftMotor The motor on the left corner.
100   * @param rightMotor The motor on the right corner.
101   * @param backMotor The motor on the back corner.
102   */
103  public KilloughDrive(
104      MotorController leftMotor, MotorController rightMotor, MotorController backMotor) {
105    this(
106        leftMotor,
107        rightMotor,
108        backMotor,
109        kDefaultLeftMotorAngle,
110        kDefaultRightMotorAngle,
111        kDefaultBackMotorAngle);
112  }
113
114  /**
115   * Construct a Killough drive with the given motors.
116   *
117   * <p>Angles are measured in degrees clockwise from the positive X axis.
118   *
119   * @param leftMotor The motor on the left corner.
120   * @param rightMotor The motor on the right corner.
121   * @param backMotor The motor on the back corner.
122   * @param leftMotorAngle The angle of the left wheel's forward direction of travel.
123   * @param rightMotorAngle The angle of the right wheel's forward direction of travel.
124   * @param backMotorAngle The angle of the back wheel's forward direction of travel.
125   */
126  public KilloughDrive(
127      MotorController leftMotor,
128      MotorController rightMotor,
129      MotorController backMotor,
130      double leftMotorAngle,
131      double rightMotorAngle,
132      double backMotorAngle) {
133    requireNonNull(leftMotor, "Left motor cannot be null");
134    requireNonNull(rightMotor, "Right motor cannot be null");
135    requireNonNull(backMotor, "Back motor cannot be null");
136
137    m_leftMotor = leftMotor;
138    m_rightMotor = rightMotor;
139    m_backMotor = backMotor;
140    m_leftVec =
141        new Vector2d(
142            Math.cos(leftMotorAngle * (Math.PI / 180.0)),
143            Math.sin(leftMotorAngle * (Math.PI / 180.0)));
144    m_rightVec =
145        new Vector2d(
146            Math.cos(rightMotorAngle * (Math.PI / 180.0)),
147            Math.sin(rightMotorAngle * (Math.PI / 180.0)));
148    m_backVec =
149        new Vector2d(
150            Math.cos(backMotorAngle * (Math.PI / 180.0)),
151            Math.sin(backMotorAngle * (Math.PI / 180.0)));
152    SendableRegistry.addChild(this, m_leftMotor);
153    SendableRegistry.addChild(this, m_rightMotor);
154    SendableRegistry.addChild(this, m_backMotor);
155    instances++;
156    SendableRegistry.addLW(this, "KilloughDrive", instances);
157  }
158
159  @Override
160  public void close() {
161    SendableRegistry.remove(this);
162  }
163
164  /**
165   * Drive method for Killough platform.
166   *
167   * <p>Angles are measured clockwise from the positive X axis. The robot's speed is independent
168   * from its angle or rotation rate.
169   *
170   * @param ySpeed The robot's speed along the Y axis [-1.0..1.0]. Right is positive.
171   * @param xSpeed The robot's speed along the X axis [-1.0..1.0]. Forward is positive.
172   * @param zRotation The robot's rotation rate around the Z axis [-1.0..1.0]. Clockwise is
173   *     positive.
174   */
175  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
176  public void driveCartesian(double ySpeed, double xSpeed, double zRotation) {
177    driveCartesian(ySpeed, xSpeed, zRotation, 0.0);
178  }
179
180  /**
181   * Drive method for Killough platform.
182   *
183   * <p>Angles are measured clockwise from the positive X axis. The robot's speed is independent
184   * from its angle or rotation rate.
185   *
186   * @param ySpeed The robot's speed along the Y axis [-1.0..1.0]. Right is positive.
187   * @param xSpeed The robot's speed along the X axis [-1.0..1.0]. Forward is positive.
188   * @param zRotation The robot's rotation rate around the Z axis [-1.0..1.0]. Clockwise is
189   *     positive.
190   * @param gyroAngle The current angle reading from the gyro in degrees around the Z axis. Use this
191   *     to implement field-oriented controls.
192   */
193  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
194  public void driveCartesian(double ySpeed, double xSpeed, double zRotation, double gyroAngle) {
195    if (!m_reported) {
196      HAL.report(
197          tResourceType.kResourceType_RobotDrive, tInstances.kRobotDrive2_KilloughCartesian, 3);
198      m_reported = true;
199    }
200
201    ySpeed = MathUtil.applyDeadband(ySpeed, m_deadband);
202    xSpeed = MathUtil.applyDeadband(xSpeed, m_deadband);
203
204    var speeds = driveCartesianIK(ySpeed, xSpeed, zRotation, gyroAngle);
205
206    m_leftMotor.set(speeds.left * m_maxOutput);
207    m_rightMotor.set(speeds.right * m_maxOutput);
208    m_backMotor.set(speeds.back * m_maxOutput);
209
210    feed();
211  }
212
213  /**
214   * Drive method for Killough platform.
215   *
216   * <p>Angles are measured counter-clockwise from straight ahead. The speed at which the robot
217   * drives (translation) is independent from its angle or rotation rate.
218   *
219   * @param magnitude The robot's speed at a given angle [-1.0..1.0]. Forward is positive.
220   * @param angle The angle around the Z axis at which the robot drives in degrees [-180..180].
221   * @param zRotation The robot's rotation rate around the Z axis [-1.0..1.0]. Clockwise is
222   *     positive.
223   */
224  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
225  public void drivePolar(double magnitude, double angle, double zRotation) {
226    if (!m_reported) {
227      HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_RobotDrive, tInstances.kRobotDrive2_KilloughPolar, 3);
228      m_reported = true;
229    }
230
231    driveCartesian(
232        magnitude * Math.sin(angle * (Math.PI / 180.0)),
233        magnitude * Math.cos(angle * (Math.PI / 180.0)),
234        zRotation,
235        0.0);
236  }
237
238  /**
239   * Cartesian inverse kinematics for Killough platform.
240   *
241   * <p>Angles are measured clockwise from the positive X axis. The robot's speed is independent
242   * from its angle or rotation rate.
243   *
244   * @param ySpeed The robot's speed along the Y axis [-1.0..1.0]. Right is positive.
245   * @param xSpeed The robot's speed along the X axis [-1.0..1.0]. Forward is positive.
246   * @param zRotation The robot's rotation rate around the Z axis [-1.0..1.0]. Clockwise is
247   *     positive.
248   * @return Wheel speeds [-1.0..1.0].
249   */
250  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
251  public WheelSpeeds driveCartesianIK(double ySpeed, double xSpeed, double zRotation) {
252    return driveCartesianIK(ySpeed, xSpeed, zRotation, 0.0);
253  }
254
255  /**
256   * Cartesian inverse kinematics for Killough platform.
257   *
258   * <p>Angles are measured clockwise from the positive X axis. The robot's speed is independent
259   * from its angle or rotation rate.
260   *
261   * @param ySpeed The robot's speed along the Y axis [-1.0..1.0]. Right is positive.
262   * @param xSpeed The robot's speed along the X axis [-1.0..1.0]. Forward is positive.
263   * @param zRotation The robot's rotation rate around the Z axis [-1.0..1.0]. Clockwise is
264   *     positive.
265   * @param gyroAngle The current angle reading from the gyro in degrees around the Z axis. Use this
266   *     to implement field-oriented controls.
267   * @return Wheel speeds [-1.0..1.0].
268   */
269  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
270  public WheelSpeeds driveCartesianIK(
271      double ySpeed, double xSpeed, double zRotation, double gyroAngle) {
272    ySpeed = MathUtil.clamp(ySpeed, -1.0, 1.0);
273    xSpeed = MathUtil.clamp(xSpeed, -1.0, 1.0);
274
275    // Compensate for gyro angle.
276    Vector2d input = new Vector2d(ySpeed, xSpeed);
277    input.rotate(-gyroAngle);
278
279    double[] wheelSpeeds = new double[3];
280    wheelSpeeds[MotorType.kLeft.value] = input.scalarProject(m_leftVec) + zRotation;
281    wheelSpeeds[MotorType.kRight.value] = input.scalarProject(m_rightVec) + zRotation;
282    wheelSpeeds[MotorType.kBack.value] = input.scalarProject(m_backVec) + zRotation;
283
284    normalize(wheelSpeeds);
285
286    return new WheelSpeeds(
287        wheelSpeeds[MotorType.kLeft.value],
288        wheelSpeeds[MotorType.kRight.value],
289        wheelSpeeds[MotorType.kBack.value]);
290  }
291
292  @Override
293  public void stopMotor() {
294    m_leftMotor.stopMotor();
295    m_rightMotor.stopMotor();
296    m_backMotor.stopMotor();
297    feed();
298  }
299
300  @Override
301  public String getDescription() {
302    return "KilloughDrive";
303  }
304
305  @Override
306  public void initSendable(SendableBuilder builder) {
307    builder.setSmartDashboardType("KilloughDrive");
308    builder.setActuator(true);
309    builder.setSafeState(this::stopMotor);
310    builder.addDoubleProperty("Left Motor Speed", m_leftMotor::get, m_leftMotor::set);
311    builder.addDoubleProperty("Right Motor Speed", m_rightMotor::get, m_rightMotor::set);
312    builder.addDoubleProperty("Back Motor Speed", m_backMotor::get, m_backMotor::set);
313  }
314}
